## Find a pathway for you  Transfer as a Junior programs, referred to as Transfer Single Articulation Pathway (TSAP) programs, are degree paths which enable students to transfer to IUPUI with junior status.  However, successful completion of a TSAP does not guarantee admission to the IUPUI degree program, and in some cases, a separate application may be required to be admitted into that program.   ### Transfer to IUPUI via the Guaranteed Admissions Agreement  The Guaranteed Admissions Agreement brings you peace of mind by providing qualified students in specific programs at Ivy Tech guaranteed admission into the related bachelor's degree program at IUPUI.  *Some Transfer as a Junior Pathways are approved for guaranteed admission - those marked with an asterisk (*) qualify!  For more details on the Guaranteed Admission Agreement including elibiligity requirements, connect with Undergraduate Admissions .  [connect with Undergraduate Admissions](https://admissions.iupui.edu/apply/transfer/gaa/index.html)   ### Transfer Single Articulation Pathways   ##### Biology*  School of Science   ##### Business Management*  Kelley School of Business   ##### Chemistry  School of Science   ##### Computer Science*  School of Science   ##### Criminal Justice*  School of Public and Environmental Affairs   ##### Elementary Education  School of Education   ##### Early Childhood Education  School of Education   ##### Informatics*  Luddy School of Informatics, Computing, and Engineering   ##### Nursing  School of Nursing   ##### Human Resource Management*  Kelley School of Business   ##### Human Services Social Work  School of Social Work   ##### Electrical Engineering Technology*  School of Engineering and Technology   ##### Mechanical Engineering  School of Engineering and Technology   ##### Mechanical Engineering Technology*  School of Engineering and Technology   ##### Psychology*  School of Science   ### Your success continues here  [Request information](https://ctas.iupui.edu/contact/index.html)  Request information  [Explore academic support](https://ctas.iupui.edu/academics/index.html)  Explore academic support  [Apply to IUPUI](https://ctas.iupui.edu/admissions/index.html)  Apply to IUPUI

## Throughout your entire unique journey, we are here for you  From application through graduation, w e are the first stop for transfer and adult students like you . With more than 7,000 graduates each year, we know there are an equal number of unique pathways to that milestone. We’re here to help you discover your own journey, no matter where your path begins.  We are your campus champions, advocates, and supporters . Through strategic planning, we support the enrollment, retention, graduation, and professional development of transfer and adult students.   ### Our mission  “The Center for Transfer & Adult Students provides solutions for students transitioning to IUPUI, understanding the unique needs of those seeking to continue their education while engaging in the university experience.”   #### What does this mean for you?  Whether you transferred to IUPUI or returned to college after some time away, we aim to be your primary place for finding supp ort, guidance, and resources at IUPUI. We offer success coaching, career services, and activities to fit your needs. We also connect you with resources like financial aid and wellness support across campus.   ### Who we serve, and how we do it  The Center for Trans fer and Adult Students serves all types of transfer and adult students, including:   #### For faculty and staff  If you're a faculty or staff member looking for more information about the Center for Transfer and Adult Students, visit our resources section.  Explore resources  We also support veterans and military personnel who identify as a transfer or adult student. However, these students should contact the Office for Veterans and Military Personnel with questions about the GI Bill.  [Office for Veterans and Military Personnel](https://veterans.iupui.edu/)   ### Have questions? We're here to answer them  Contact us  [Current student? Schedule an appointment](https://sisjee.iu.edu/essweb-prd/web/sas/student/init/)  Current student? Schedule an appointment  Meet our team

## Your IUPUI education: An affordable and worthwhile investment  There’s no question that a college education is a big investment: an investment of your time, energy, and financial resources. When you choose IUPUI, you’re ensuring you get a great value for your tuition dollars.  With m ore than 80% of our degree - seeking undergraduates receiv ing financial aid, our commitment is clear: we provid e you with an affordable college experience. We strive to keep tuition low, offer substantial aid, and provide programs that minimize your debt.  Transferring from another institution? We’ll help make sure your aid transfers with you. Returning to school after some time away? Explore sc holarships, grants, and money management strategies that will help you fit your education into your budget.   ### Step 1: Know your costs  We understand the importance of planning for this investment and knowing up - front what costs are associated with your educa tion. At IUPUI, your tuition and fees depend on your program, whether you’re an Indiana resident or not, and more.  Student Central is your hub for information related to the cost of IUPUI. Check out these helpful resources.  [Student Central](https://studentcentral.iupui.edu/index.html)  [Tuition & Fees Learn about the costs associated with attending IUPUI.](https://studentcentral.iupui.edu/cost/tuition-fees/index.html)   #### Tuition & Fees  Learn about the costs associated with attending IUPUI.  [Cost of Attendance Review estimated costs for tuition, fees, books, housing, transportation, and personal expenses](https://studentcentral.iupui.edu/cost/cost-of-attendance/index.html)   #### Cost of Attendance  Review estimated costs for tuition, fees, books, housing, transportation, and personal expenses  [Net Price Calculator Estimate the tuition and fees specific to you.](https://studentcentral.iupui.edu/cost/net-price-calculator/index.html)   #### Net Price Calculator  Estimate the tuition and fees specific to you.   ### Step 2: Fund your education  We get it: the thought of paying for college can be overwhelming. Financial aid can help you cover the costs.  Consider these options for paying for your IUPUI experience:  [Scholarships A form of financial aid considered “gift aid” that you don’t have to repay. The more scholarships you receive, the less student debt you’ll carry.](https://studentcentral.iupui.edu/funding/scholarships/index.html)   #### Scholarships  A form of financial aid considered “gift aid” that you don’t have to repay. The more scholarships you receive, the less student debt you’ll carry.  [Grants Another type of gift aid you don’t have to repay. They’re usually awarded based on financial need as indicated in your FAFSA.](https://studentcentral.iupui.edu/funding/grants/index.html)   #### Grants  Another type of gift aid you don’t have to repay. They’re usually awarded based on financial need as indicated in your FAFSA.  [Loans A form of financial aid you’ll have to repay. Student loans are available through the Federal government, private banks, credit unions, and other lenders.](https://studentcentral.iupui.edu/funding/loans/index.html)   #### Loans  A form of financial aid you’ll have to repay. Student loans are available through the Federal government, private banks, credit unions, and other lenders.  [Federal Work-Study A form of need-based aid, where you earn money through a part-time job on or off campus](https://studentcentral.iupui.edu/funding/work-study.html)   #### Federal Work-Study  A form of need-based aid, where you earn money through a part-time job on or off campus  Transfer students: Don't miss these scholarships that are just for you! Check out transfer scholarships  [Check out transfer scholarships](https://admissions.iupui.edu/cost-aid/scholarships/transfer-scholarships.html)   #### Applying for financial aid  In most cases, you’ll begin wi th the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) . When you submit your FAFSA, you’re considered for a variety of state and federal financial aid programs. Some of our admission - based scholarships are based on need, and will consider your FAFSA. The FAFSA is available October 1, and the priority deadline is March 10. Learn more about applying for financial aid .  [Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)](https://studentaid.gov/h/apply-for-aid/fafsa/)  [Learn more about](https://studentcentral.iupui.edu/funding/apply-financial-aid/steps-to-apply/index.html)  [applying for financial aid](https://studentcentral.iupui.edu/funding/apply-financial-aid/steps-to-apply/index.html)     ##### Transfer students  Find ou t specific steps you’ll take in applying for aid.  Transfer student financial aid  [Transfer student financial aid](https://studentcentral.iupui.edu/funding/apply-financial-aid/steps-to-apply/transfer.html)   ##### Ivy Tech students  If you’re taking classes at Ivy Tech, learn about your next steps.  Ivy Tech financial aid  [Ivy Tech financial aid](https://studentcentral.iupui.edu/funding/apply-financial-aid/steps-to-apply/ivy-tech.html)   ### Step 3: Practice financial wellness  We want to help you make good financial decisions throughout your time applying to, learning at, and moving beyond IUPUI. The Office of Financial Literacy established MoneySmarts, a university - wide initiative to help you learn how to be financially well.  Find financial management resources, get expert advice, or even talk to a peer financial educator about your personal financial situation.  Learn about MoneySmarts  [Learn about MoneySmarts](https://moneysmarts.iu.edu/)

## Two institutions, one mission: Your success  Through a strong partnership between IUPUI and Ivy Tech Community College Indianapolis, we provide you with a smoo th transition between the two institutions. Through the Passport Program , we facilitate convenient access to educational opportunities that fit your needs at both institutions.   ### The Passport Program: IUPUI and Ivy Tech  Our staff at IUPUI and Ivy Tech Indianapolis assist you with everything from transferring credits to transferring financial aid. Qualifying students can take degree - focused courses at both IUPUI and Ivy Tech at the same time. We also offer funding and fee - waiver opportunities for Passport students.  Our commitment to you As key partners in driving degree completion through transfer in Marion, Hendricks, and Boone Counties, Ivy Tech Indianapolis and IUPUI are deeply committed to the educational goals of all students. Students transferring across our institutions will experience coordinated, equitable, holistic, and developmentally appropriate support.    As students pursue their degrees, they will be intentionally connected to high-quality curricular and co-curricular learning experiences and provided continuous access to opportunities for support. Their experiences will be based on a theoretical framework that supports the unique needs of transfer students, including opportunities to support academic and social integration as well as attainment of academic and career goals.  To put it simply , we help you make the smoothest transition possible from Ivy Tech Indianapolis to IUPUI.  12% of IUPUI students are Ivy Tech transfer students.  45% Of new first-time Ivy Tech transfer students are from underrepresented populations.  57% of Ivy Tech transfer students came to IUPUI with an associate degree.  $1,378 higher average starting salary for Ivy Tech transfer than non-Ivy Tech transfers.   ### Our history: Thirty years of partnership  In February 1990, IUPUI and Ivy Tech Vocational College (now known as Ivy Tech Community College) executed our first Memorandum of Agreement to support student success. In 1998, we coined the term “Passport,” and the Passport Program launched as a jointly funded office between Ivy Tech Community College Indianapolis service area (ITISA) and IUPUI. ITISA includes the following Ivy Tech campuses :  As the name implies, Passport facilitates travel – for Ivy Tech students to IUPUI and much more.   ### The Passport impact  Passport services are vital to the success of IUPUI and Ivy Tech Indianapolis transfer students. Our partnership with Ivy Tech enables you to take classes at b oth institutions via the financial aid consortium agreement. Although the Passport Program serves Ivy Tech’s Indianapolis Service region of approximately 19,000 students, Ivy Tech Community College is a unified statewide system that serves more than 170,00 0 students each year. Ivy Tech is the state’s largest postsecondary institution and the country’s largest single - accredited statewide community college system.  [Guaranteed admissions Ivy Tech students benefit from guaranteed admission to many IUPUI programs, including an application fee waiver.](https://admissions.iupui.edu/apply/transfer/gaa/index.html)   #### Guaranteed admissions  Ivy Tech students benefit from guaranteed admission to many IUPUI programs, including an application fee waiver.  [Explore transfer pathways Transfer pathways help you make a seamless transition from Ivy Tech to IUPUI while staying on track to graduate. Discover your options.](https://ctas.iupui.edu/transfer/index.html#pathways)   #### Explore transfer pathways  Transfer pathways help you make a seamless transition from Ivy Tech to IUPUI while staying on track to graduate. Discover your options.  [Transfer financial aid Connect with Student Financial Services to transfer your aid to IUPUI.](https://studentcentral.iupui.edu/index.html)   #### Transfer financial aid  Connect with Student Financial Services to transfer your aid to IUPUI.

## Complete the Ivy Tech guest application  If you are currently enrolled at IUPUI and want to take a class at Ivy Tech, you must complete the guest student application.  Complete Ivy Tech’s guest student application  [Complete Ivy Tech’s guest student application](https://forms.ivytech.edu/f/apply?app=guest)   ### Ivy Tech guest application instructions   #### Guest application instructions for domestic students   ##### Domestic Students   ###### Purpose:  IUPUI students can register for and enroll in course (s) at Ivy Tech Community College-Indianapolis Service Area while maintaining IUPUI as their home institution via the Ivy Tech Guest Student Application. To qualify for the use of the Ivy Tech Guest Student Application, an IUPUI student must be in good standing (not dismissed) and concurrently enrolled in at least one course at IUPUI for fall and spring semesters. There is no concurrent enrollment requirement for the summer semester unless the student plans to use the Passport Financial Assistance Agreement.   ###### Deadlines:  *Please contact the Passport Office to confirm deadlines, as they are subject to change per semester. NOTE: Ivy Tech begins registering for courses one (1) month before IUPUI. It is recommended that students turn in a completed Ivy Tech Guest Student Application as soon as possible.   ##### Ivy Tech Guest Student Application Process - IUPUI Domestic Students  [here](https://forms.ivytech.edu/f/apply?app=guest)  [a verification of academic standing form](https://www.ivytech.edu/files/Guest-Student-Verification-Form.pdf)  [course schedule search](https://banprd-ssb.ivytech.edu/BANNER/bwckschd.p_disp_dyn_sched)  [Indianapolis Service Area Location](https://www.ivytech.edu/indianapolis/5980.html)  [electronically.](https://ivytech.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_51M31aeowsenX8x)  NOTE: Students must receive a minimum grade of "C" or above unless a higher grade is needed as noted by a student's IUPUI academic advisor, for the Ivy Tech course to transfer to IUPUI and apply toward the student’s IUPUI major.   ##### Passport Financial Assistance Agreement (PFAA)  *Starting fall 2016, students enrolled in 12-18 credit hours at IUPUI should consult with the IUPUI Office of Student Financial Services for financial aid eligibility.  [Passport Financial Assistance Agreement (PFAA)](https://studentcentral.iupui.edu/doc/funding/iupui-passport-form.pdf)  NOTE: The Passport Office does not accept the Passport Financial Assistance Agreement.  [IUPUI's Office for Veterans and Military Personnel](http://veterans.iupui.edu/contact/)   ##### Obtaining Ivy Tech Transcripts  When a student has completed their Ivy Tech guest course(s), they must request an official transcript from Ivy Tech to IUPUI for a fee of $5 to ensure the credit hours transfer to IUPUI.  This official transcript may be requested through the student’s Ivy Tech ‘My Ivy’ account and sent electronically to IUPUI’s Office of Undergraduate Admissions at mycredit@iupui.edu .  If the student is having difficulty accessing their ‘My Ivy’ account, the student can contact Parchment Exchange (the online transcript request system) at the Ivy Tech Registrar Office . Select the "Click here to request your transcript" hyperlink to be redirected to the Parchment Exchange form.  [Ivy Tech Registrar Office](https://www.ivytech.edu/registrar/3449.html)  Questions regarding the evaluation timeline of Ivy Tech transcripts should be directed to the IUPUI Office of Undergraduate Admissions at 317-274-4591, extension 0.   #### Guest application instructions for international students   ##### International Students   ###### Purpose:  IUPUI students can register for and enroll in course (s) at Ivy Tech Community College-Indianapolis Service Area while maintaining IUPUI as their home institution via the Ivy Tech Guest Student Application.  To qualify for the use of the Ivy Tech Guest Student Application, an IUPUI student must be in good standing (not dismissed) and concurrently enrolled in at least one course at IUPUI for fall and spring semesters. There is no concurrent enrollment requirement for the summer semester unless the student plans to use the Passport Financial Assistance Agreement.   ##### Deadlines:  *Please contact the Passport Office to confirm deadlines, as they are submitted to change per semester. NOTE: Ivy Tech begins registering for courses one (1) month before IUPUI. It is recommended that students turn in a completed Ivy Tech Guest Student Application as soon as possible.   ##### Ivy Tech Guest Student Application Process - IUPUI International Students  [here](https://ivytech.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_51M31aeowsenX8x)  [a verification of academic standing form](https://www.ivytech.edu/files/Guest-Student-Verification-Form.pdf)  [course schedule search](https://banprd-ssb.ivytech.edu/BANNER/bwckschd.p_disp_dyn_sched)  [Indianapolis Service Area Location](https://www.ivytech.edu/indianapolis/5980.html)  [electronically.](https://ivytech.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_51M31aeowsenX8x)  NOTE : If the student holds an F-1 visa, you must submit an electronic copy of your I-20 to process the Ivy Tech Guest Student Application. Without the entire I-20, the application will not be processed. Visas are NOT acceptable.  NOTE: Students must receive a minimum grade of "C" or above unless a higher grade is needed as noted by a student's IUPUI academic advisor, for the Ivy Tech course to transfer to IUPUI and apply toward the student’s IUPUI major.   ##### Additional Notes for IUPUI International Students  [IUPUI Office of International Affairs.](http://international.iupui.edu/about/contact.html)  [iStart account](https://atlas.iu.edu/istart/controllers/start/StartEngine.cfm)  [IUPUI Office of International Affairs website](http://international.iupui.edu/visas/f1-students/enrollment/index.html)  Saudi Arabian Cultural Mission (SACM) Students  After an IUPUI SACM student submits their Ivy Tech Guest Student Application, the student should prepare to submit two (2) items to their SACM advisor:   ##### Passport Financial Assistance Agreement (PFAA)  Starting fall 2016, students enrolled in 12-18 credit hours at IUPUI should consult with the IUPUI Office of Student Financial Services for financial aid eligibility.>  [Passport Financial Assistance Agreement (PFAA)](https://studentcentral.iupui.edu/doc/funding/iupui-passport-form.pdf)  NOTE: The Passport Office does not accept the Passport Financial Assistance Agreement.  [IUPUI's Office for Veterans and Military Personnel](http://veterans.iupui.edu/contact/)   ##### Obtaining Ivy Tech Transcripts  When a student has completed their Ivy Tech guest course(s), they must request an official transcript from Ivy Tech to IUPUI for a fee of $5 to ensure the credit hours transfer to IUPUI.  This official transcript may be requested through the student’s Ivy Tech ‘My Ivy’ account and sent electronically to IUPUI’s Office of Undergraduate Admissions at mycredit@iupui.edu .  If the student is having difficulty accessing their ‘My Ivy’ account, the student can contact Parchment Exchange (the online transcript request system) at the Ivy Tech Registrar Office . Select the "Click here to request your transcript" hyperlink to be redirected to the Parchment Exchange form.  [Ivy Tech Registrar Office](https://www.ivytech.edu/registrar/3449.html)  Questions regarding the evaluation timeline of Ivy Tech transcripts should be directed to the IUPUI Office of Undergraduate Admissions at 317-274-4591, extension 0.   ### Complete the Passport Financial Assistance Form  The Passport Financial Assistance Agreement is a coordinated effort between Ivy Tech Community College-Indianapolis Service Area and IUPUI that allows enrollment at both institutions to be considered for financial aid purposes. To complete the Passport financial assistance, follow the following link to learn more about the process.  Learn more  [Learn more](https://studentcentral.iupui.edu/funding/apply-financial-aid/steps-to-apply/ivy-tech.html)

## IUPUI: An affordable and worthwhile education  Home to two of Indiana’s top universities, IUPUI offers you a quality, real - world education where you’re in control of your experience. Choose an Indiana University or Purdue University degree, decide how you want to engage on campus, and create an academic schedule that meets your li festyle.  We are committed to providing transformative educational opportunities to you, our students, in ways that change the world around us. We are Indiana’s premier urban research university offering more than 450 academic programs and creating a welco ming environment where you belong.   ### Come visit us  Join us for a campus visit and explore what it means to live and learn in the heart of downtown Indianapolis! Tours of IUPUI and campus events are offered through the Office of Undergraduate Admissions and a re held year - round. Visiting IUPUI – physically or virtually – is the best way to learn about your opportunities as a student at IUPUI.  Visit IUPUI  [Visit IUPUI](https://admissions.iupui.edu/visit/index.html)   ### Learn about degree programs  Looking for all your options? We have hundreds of academic programs from IU and Purdue to help you pursue your career goals.  Discover all IUPUI degree programs  [Discover all IUPUI degree programs](https://www.iupui.edu/academics/degrees-majors/index.html)  You know you want to complete your degree, but how do you know which program will help you meet your goals and fit your busy lifestyle? Whether you are full time in the workfor ce, a stay - at - home parent , or a recent retiree, we understand that those who are thinking of transferring to IUPUI or going back to school are also occupied with all sorts of obligations. With our expertise, we'll help you find a degree program that m eets your needs — from online class options to professors with real - world experience and connections.  Contact us  Here’s to the red, gold, black, and white. Fight, Jaguars, fight!   ### Find out what it means to be a Jaguar  Jaguars are bold , driven , and optimistic . As an IUPUI student, you will join others striving for success. Join one of 500+ student organizations, find resources and support, or take advantage of recreation and wellness opportunities. We are a diverse campus community reflective of our urban environment – a community that welcomes and includes everyone.  Explore student life

## We help you make a successful transfer  The transfer process can seem confusing, but it doesn't need to be. We're here to support you by guiding you through the process and answering your questions. The Office of Undergraduate Admissions is your starting point for this process.   #### Questions about transfer credit?  Contact Jared Baker, CTAS Student Records Coordinator, at jartbake@iupui.edu   ### Prepare to transfer  When you're getting ready to transfer, the Office of Undergraduate Admissions will review your coursework from any other colleges or universities to determine whether you will receive credit at IUPUI for that coursework.  You are also encouraged to review courses and submit syllabi for previous coursework you would like IUPUI to review. This process may save you time and money, too. Tools for estimating how your credit will transfer are available in the resources section.  Learn more about transferring credit  [Learn more about transferring credit](https://admissions.iupui.edu/apply/transfer-credit/index.html)  If you're transfering from another IU campus, your credit will automatically appear on your IUPUI academic record for an advisor to review and apply to your degree program.   ## Resources to help you transfer   ### Credit Explorer  When you transfer to IUPUI, the Office of Undergraduate Admissions conducts an initial review of coursework you have completed at any other colleges or universities to determine if you will receive credit at IUPUI. The school or department of your major then decides how your transfer credit will apply to your degree requirements. Explore IU's Credit Transfer Service to see how your credits might transfer.  Visit the Credit Explorer  [Visit the Credit Explorer](https://sisjee.iu.edu/essweb-prd/web/sisad/trex/public.html?campus=IUINA)   ### Transfer Rule Catalog  Use the Transfer Rule Catalog if you're transferring from a private college or university in Indiana or an out-of-state school.  Visit the Transfer Rule Catalog  [Visit the Transfer Rule Catalog](https://tes.collegesource.com/publicview/TES_publicview01.aspx?rid=d1176a12-6125-4acc-8f4b-e87e7d818b33&aid=77c8af8a-783e-4055-a5bd-d13912e2f672)   ### Core Transfer Library  Indiana's Core Transfer Library helps you find lists of courses that are pre-approved for transfer between all Indiana public college and university campuses and six independent colleges and universities.  Visit the Core Transfer Library  [Visit the Core Transfer Library](https://transferin.net/earned-credits/core-transfer-library/)

## Earning Credit for Prior Learning  Individuals come to college from a variety of backgrounds and experiences, some of which may involve college-level learning. Credit for Prior Learning ( CPL ) is the evaluation and assessment of an individual’s life learning for college credit, certification , or advanced standing toward future education or training. CPL is a process used by regulatory bodies to evaluate skills and knowledge acquired outside the classroom for the purpose of recognizing competence against a given set of standards, competencies or learning outcomes. Equivalent credit is awarded through a variety of methods; each school or department at IUPUI determines its own process. Complete the form below to inquire about CPL .  Your completed and approved CPL results in credits for approved courses on your transcript. See IU Policy ACA-60 for details.  [IU Policy ACA-60](https://policies.iu.edu/policies/aca-60-credit-for-prior-learning/archived-02242023.html)  Complete the following form if you have interest in earning credit for prior experiences.   ### Types of credit assessment   #### Certifications   #### Credit-by-exam  [CLEP](https://advising.iupui.edu/placement-and-registration/placement-information/ap-clep-dantes-placement.html)  [DSST](https://advising.iupui.edu/placement-and-registration/placement-information/ap-clep-dantes-placement.html)  [AP](https://admissions.iupui.edu/apply/transfer-credit/ap-credit.html)  [IB](https://admissions.iupui.edu/apply/transfer-credit/ib-credit.html)   #### Military experience  Active-duty and veterans can receive college credit for military service and save time and money at the same time. A Joint Services Transcript (JST) should be submitted with the application materials for consideration.   #### Portfolios   #### Test out   #### Transfer credit   ### Which schools or departments award CPL?   ### Are there any general policies or fees associated with CPL?  See individual types of assessment above for any CPL -type-specific policies or fees. For general policies and fees, see this helpful overview of special credit from the Office of the Registrar.  [this helpful overview of special credit](https://facultystaffcentral.iupui.edu/enrollment/special-credit.html)   ### Contact for more information  If you have more questions, please feel free to reach out to your assigned academic advisor, who you can find in IU’s Student Online Advising Records (SOAR) system. You are also welcome to contact us here in the Center for Transfer and Adult Students at ctas@iupui.edu or 317-278-2630.  [Student Online Advising Records (SOAR)](https://one.iu.edu/task/iu/student-advising-records)

## Your prior experience and coursework matter  You've worked hard to get where you are, and it's important to have this work counted. Whether you're wanting to see how a course you've taken will count at IUPUI or you want to learn more about testing out of certain courses, we'll help answer your questions.  What is transfer credit? IUPUI defines transfer credit as any credit awarded for coursework completed outside of the Indiana University system.   ## Learn how to transfer to IUPUI  We know there's a lot to figure out when you're preparing to transfer to IUPUI. We're here to help. Learn about the transfer process, how credits can transfer, and what resources are here to support you.  Find out how to transfer   ### Credit for prior learning  Our transfer and adult students come to IUPUI from a variety of backgrounds and experiences, many of which involve college-level learning.  Some schools and programs provide pathways for you to attain college credit for knowledge you have already mastered outside the traditional classroom.  Types of credit assessment include   #### Find out if your experiences will count  Learn more about credit for prior learning   ### Explore transfer pathways from Ivy Tech to IUPUI  Through partnership with Ivy Tech Community College, IUPUI has several articulation agreements that help you make a seamless transfer. These agreements outline how credits transfer and let you know what classes to take which semester to stay on track for graduation.  Plus, the Guaranteed Admissions Agreement brings you peace of mind by providing qualified students in specific programs at Ivy Tech guaranteed admission into the related bachelor's degree program at IUPUI. Learn more about about the agreement.  [Learn more about about the agreement.](https://admissions.iupui.edu/apply/transfer/gaa/index.html)   #### Transfer as a Junior Programs  These programs, also known as Transfer Single Articulation Pathways (TSAP), are for students participating in the Passport Program and transferring from a qualifying Ivy Tech campus. They enable students to transfer to IUPUI with junior status.  Learn about TSAP options   #### 2+2 Programs  Also known as articulation agreements, 2+2 programs outline course requirements at qualifying Ivy Tech campuses and IUPUI to streamline your path to graduation.  Discover 2+2 options   #### 1+3 Programs  Also known as Indiana's Statewide Transfer General Education Core (STGEC), this pathway helps you begin as a sophomore at any Indiana four-year institution.  Review the STGEC  [Review the STGEC](https://www.ivytech.edu/gen-ed-transfer-core/index.html)  Please note: Any Ivy tech student completing the STGEC and taking MATH123 may need to take more math classes after transferring, depending on the major you choose.   ### Is there a limit to how much credit I can transfer?  There are some limits to how much credit can be accepted through transfer. For example, IU policy limits the total number of transfer credits from Associate’s Colleges to no more than 64 credit hours, though some degree programs have further restrictions. The policy also notes that 100- and 200-level courses generally cannot be transferred as 300- or 400-level courses at IUPUI.  [IU policy](https://policies.iu.edu/policies/aca-56-transfer-credit-two-year-institutions/index.html)  Another policy to be aware of is residency requirements. Though these vary by degree program, schools generally require that 30 to 60 credits be completed at IUPUI in order to earn an IUPUI degree. These policies can be found in each school’s bulletin.  [each school’s bulletin.](https://bulletins.iu.edu/iupui/index.html)
